name: politico
text: Both sides have made concessions in the Covid relief talks, but there are still a ton of outstanding issues ‚Äî and the two sides are pretty far apart üëá https://t.co/4nzlXWOu9k

name: politico
text:
Enhanced unempolyment benefits:
‚Ä¢ The GOP holds that this offer ‚Äî $400/ week until Dec. 15 ‚Äî is a big move on their behalf. 
‚Ä¢ Democrats are holding at $600 per week
‚Ä¢ Republicans also want to include the return-to-work credit
https://t.co/4nzlXWOu9k

name: politico
text:
Elections:
There is significant disagreement here. Republicans believe that Democrats are trying to fund a massive mail-in ballot program, but, as Schumer reminded the room, it is up to each state to decide how the money is spent
https://t.co/4nzlXWOu9k

name: politico
text:
Education:
They have disagreement on the top line, and how it‚Äôs allocated. Semantics, but important: Republicans say that education should be counted as a state and local funding issue, and Democrats say this is nonsense.
https://t.co/4nzlXWOu9k

name: politico
text:
Childcare:
Dems are at $50 billion and Republicans are at $15 billion, so the two sides have a ways to go. The negotiators decided to move on from discussing this.
https://t.co/4nzlXWOu9k

name: politico
text:
Renter/homeowner insurance:
Republicans proposed their eviction moratorium, and Democrats didn‚Äôt like it ‚Äî and fought over it. They think there‚Äôs more to do here. https://t.co/4nzlXWOu9k

name: politico
text:
Testing:
Still a ways to go here, but they seem to want to come to a conclusion. Democrats are selling their plan as being ‚Äúconservative‚Äù ‚Äî decentralizing power to the states to test. Democrats suggested the GOP was too bureaucratic. https://t.co/4nzlXWOu9k
